overview: The trajectory of the Portuguese professor and activist Vítor Ramos is revisited by the look of his daughter Guiomar Ramos. Through letters and photographs, in addition to a trip to the countries where her father lived, she seeks to understand the circumstances of his death, very close to the Carnation Revolution (25/04/1974), a movement that would take him out of political exile after twenty years away from home.
title: Por Parte de Pai
